content.description: Start at the first vertical crack left of the areté.  Climb this crack until it turns right and becomes horizontal, then step right and around the nose to the face.  Climb this decreasingly steep face to the top.
content.protection: Finger size cams.  Easy to build an anchor at the top (more cams up to .75")  and/or walk-off.
content.location: Straddles the nose-like corner between the Beam Me Up Scotty crack + roof and the Captain's Log face.

content.protection: Looks very scarce.  Double bolted anchor available, or build your own - can run both Kling-Ons off one anchor if you do it right.

content.description: Never climbed this one; including for completeness sake.
content.location: Around corner to right of Under Kling-On; follow twin crack straight to top.  Easy walk-off.

content.description:
Start under the small overhanging roof just to the left of TP (and to the right of Under-Klingon). Go straight up the arete. 

  The start is the best part. There are two ways to start, either hold the right edge and layback, or reach for the edge sticking out up on the left.
content.protection: I top-roped it... bolts on top. Someone else please enter trad info.

content.description: Tricky start with a thin crux and an honest-to-goodness "naughty finger-pocket", this route is the best on the wall.  If you avoid the crux by moving left or right, it's not nearly as interesting.
content.protection: Never led it; the pro looks acceptable.  All gear anchor or double-bolted anchor; the DBA is better-used on the routes to the right, so build your own.
content.location: Climb the obvious dihedral to right of Captain's Log.  Easy walk-off.

content.description: Start just to the right of Hanky inside the mini chimney. Work your way up and grab hold of the mini arête as a layback then walk yourself up the wall until you can stand on the top of the ledge over the mini chimney. ***You can only put your hands on the right face, no hands on the left until you are standing on the ledge or it's more Hanky than Panky!
content.protection: Share a top rope with Hanky

content.description: Never climbed this one; including it for completeness sake.
content.location: Five feet right of T.P./four feet left of boulders; climb straight up face to weird flakes, then to top.  Easy walk-off.

content.description: A "slab" climb with a very tricky start; I've seen 5.5 leaders back off this route, as the starting move isn't well-protected. I've also seen several people continue straight up the face, while the route actually goes up and left; you can wander into some distinctly not 5.4 territory if you're not careful (see discussion in comments). There's a shelf with some greenery in it, nearly at the top; you want to stay left of that.
content.protection: Pro is adequate, but can be fiddly to place.  Bolts 10' back from the top.
content.location: Start on top of the block at base of the face; climb obvious seam to the top, trending left.  Easy walk-off.

content.description: On the west-facing wall left of Captain's Log.  Follow the pleasant, obvious crack (5.6) to the overhang, then be prepared for long reaches and powerful climbing.  Grading is tough because the moves are difficult to figure out.  Done juuust right, this should be 11ish, but you can flame out trying to work out the sequence.  In any event, the goal is to get to the big ledge on the arete to the right.  From there you can either finish easily up the Captains Log face, or step left back onto the west face for a couple moderate moves to the scratchy pine at the route's top.
content.protection: I'm only aware of TR action on this.  There are a couple spots where gear MIGHT be placed, but both are funky and it would be difficult to fiddle in anything on lead.  Still, if you're solid at the grade...  The last solid gear is below the overhang and a fall from late in the crux would surely put you on the shelf at the base.

content.description: Shaded belay area, partially shaded routes, completely open top of cliff.  Enterprise Wall has one of the few double-bolted anchors in Peterskill - but it's not in the right place for all the routes, and setting up more than one route on the bolts is unwise.  There are plenty of placement opportunities for gear.
